page.title: 01A COTSWOLD VILLAGE
page.content: { Sherston}is a medium sized village about 5 miles to the south west of Malmesbury towards the southern end of the{Cotswold Hills.}Many of its older houses and the walls surrounding many of the fields are built of pale Jurassic limestone and the roofs are made of the heavy Cotswold tiles. A remnant of the early wool and weaving{industry}typical of the area is a small factory producing lingerie elastic, whilst building, transport and agricultural engineering firms serve the needs of a quite extensive area.{Retailing}of meat,wine, cider and spiced condiments are developing the agricultural tradition, whilst an educational software company shows the village to be no sleepy backwater. Over 100 new houses since 1970 have brought to the village newcomers who commute to work.
